span.span: Our mission is to build a partnership of students, families, staff and community members in order to create an educational community dedicated to excellence.

span.div: Click Here for the "We Miss You!" video from the staff to the students.

div.span: for the April 7, 2020 Parent COVID-19 School Closure Update Letter

span.div: Click Here for the New York State of Health Letter

Click Here for March 30, 2020 Parent Letter - District Update During COVID-19 Outbreak
March 24, 2020
Stamford Central School is working to put systems in place which will assist in learning continuity efforts and communication during the COVID-19 outbreak.
We need a:
parent email address, and we also need to know
if you have internet access at home
*Before we begin with the directions to share your email address and internet access capabilities, we want you to know that this message has been posted on our webpage to allow you to read the transcript of this call.
Please listen to the following brief directions which will assist us in these efforts:
Please create an email from whatever system that you may use (Google, Microsoft, Yahoo, etc.).
Use the following email address to send us an email.
[email protected]
Write in the email if you have internet access at home and anything else related to internet access you think may be helpful – examples:
We have high-speed internet.
Our internet is slow.
We have no internet access at home.
This message has been added to the District website and will also be posted on Facebook which will allow you to see the message again before you respond.
This information is needed to help us continue to meet your child’s educational needs. Thank you.

div.span: Due to the weather changing on Monday, March 23, 2020, Stamford Central School will be putting together the food delivery today, March 22, 2020. Buses plan to leave the school between 3:00 p.m. and 3:30 p.m. Please remember social distancing when bags are being delivered.

span.span: With changes being made by Governor Cuomo today (March 20, 2020), Stamford Central School has to make changes to the food delivery schedule.

Starting Monday, March 23, 2020 , Stamford Central School will only be making food deliveries on Mondays and Thursdays.The Monday delivery will have food for Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. The Thursday delivery will have food for Thursday and Friday.

div.span: The buses will leave school at 12:00 p.m. for delivery.

span.span: Thank you for your understanding as changes need to be made.

span.p: (Children Health and Medical Programs at Stamford) as of March 20, 2020

With the every changing situations that we are facing, C.H.A.M.P.S., your School-Based Health Center will be closed until further notice. If you need any prescriptions refills or you have a question, please call 1-844-ALL-SBHC (255-7242) to speak to a School-Based employee during normal business hours. If it is after hours and you need assistance, please call 1-800-BASSETT (227-7388). If you think that you or a family member has COVID-19 and would like to be tested, please call the Bassett Healthcare COVID-19 triage line at 607-547-5555.

div.p:
Take care and be safe!
Patty Brewster

div.span: Stamford CSD COVID-19 Closure Information Update: March 19, 2020
for Stamford COVID-19 First Responder Healthcare Survey Questions (March18, 2020)

With the closure of schools due to the outbreak of COVID-19, we are interested in receiving information from parents who may be a professional healthcare provider or first responder. Please see the link provided for further information.
for the Bassett School Based Health Clinic Access During Extended School Closing as of March 16, 2020
Delaware County Public Health Order for Extended School Closing as of March 16, 2020
for the Parent Meal Delivery Notification During Extended School Closing as of March 16, 2020

Stamford Central School will hold regularly scheduled classes on Monday, March 16, 2020. Teachers will be giving out classwork and explaining ways for students to use their IPads and Laptops to complete classwork during the weeks ahead. School will close at 3:00 p.m. on Monday, March 16, 2020 to everyone except employees. At this time, students will return to school on Tuesday, April 14, 2020. C.R.O.P. is cancelled until further notice.
for updated information as of March 14, 2020 from the DELAWARE COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
for updated information as of March 11, 2020
Delaware County Public Health has declared a state emergency in response to COVID-19. The Order suspends school functions in Delaware County, including Stamford CSD,
. When planning an extended closing, there needs to be time for students to gather lessons and resources, etc

b.i: . The SPECIFIC date of our school closing has not been determined yet but you will be notified as soon as possible, since the emergency declaration came out this evening at 8:00 p.m.

div.span: It is highly recommended that parents begin to plan for child care needs with this extended closing. Contingency plans are being developed for students needing nutritional services. I appreciate your patience during this unprecedented health concern.
for updated information as of March 14, 2020 from the DELAWARE COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE

span.div: In response to the changing nature of COVID-19, only PARENTS/GUARDIANS
or those with OFFICIAL SCHOOL BUSINESS will be admitted during the instructional day.
Thank you for your understanding and cooperation

span.span: Stamford Central School would like to let parents and guardians know of important information. Please do not enter the building until after 2:45 p.m. to pick up your children. Only in the event that you need to sign your children out of school for an appointment will you be entering the building before 2:45 p.m.
Students are not to be dropped off at school in the morning until 7:45 a.m. or later. Supervision is not available until 7:45 a.m.
Students will be standing outside until the doors unlock at 7:45 a.m. Following this rule will ensure safety for your children.
This information is for the safety of all the students on the school property. We appreciate your understanding and hope that you follow our guidelines.
